thread.title: Here’s Jimmy Fallon with your Patriots and Colts NFL superlatives - Football
thread.title_full: Here’s Jimmy Fallon with your Patriots and Colts NFL superlatives - Football

author: boston.com
title: Here’s Jimmy Fallon with your Patriots and Colts NFL superlatives - Football
text:
Just in time for the Patriots to face off against the Colts Sunday, Tonight Show host Jimmy Fallon is here to hand out the next rendition of his ever-popular NFL superlatives.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below While he lobbed gags at Malcolm Butler and Danny Amendola last time the Pats received the superlatives treatment in January, Jerod Mayo’s last name, Dont’a Hightower’s hair, and Joe Cardona’s, uh, face took the brunt of the jokes this time around.
“Joe Cardona from the Patriots, he was voted Most Likely to Make this Face When Passing by the Lingerie Section at Kohl’s,” Fallon said.
The one thing missing from Fallon’s set was a round of Deflategate jokes. After all, we know there’ve been enough of those.
Old Patriots in new NFL uniforms:
Previous -- of -- Next Darrelle Revis helped lead the 2014 Patriots to a Super Bowl-winning season. In his 16 regular season games, the shutdown cornerback had 41 tackles, one forced fumble, and two interceptions. Paul Sancya / AP Previous -- of -- Next Cornerback Brandon Browner was also a key member of the Super XLIX-winning team. He played nine regular season games with the Patriots, and recorded 20 tackles and one interception. Amber Searls / USA Today Previous -- of -- Next Kyle Arrington spent six seasons with New England and won one Super Bowl. Predominantely a slot cornerback, he played 86 games with the Patriots with nine interceptions. Patrick Semansky / AP Previous -- of -- Next Shane Vereen spent four years in the Patriots offensive backfield, where he played 42 games. In his 324 touches, he racked up 1,930 yards and 14 touchdowns. Ed Mulholland / USA Today Previous -- of -- Next Running back Stevan Ridley rushed for 2,817 yards and 22 touchdowns during his 52 games with New England. Ridley was the Patriots' 2011 third-round selection. Julio Cortez / AP Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Two-time Super Bowl winner Vince Wilfork was drafted by the Patriots in the first round of the 2004 NFL Draft. He played 158 games in his 11 years with the Patriots, compiling 351 tackles, 16 sacks, four forced fumbles, and three interceptions. Patric Schneider / AP Previous -- of -- Next The Patriots acquired Akeem Ayers in a trade during the 2014 season. Ayers had four sacks in nine regular season games with the Patriots. Tom Gannam/AP Previous -- of -- Next Tim Wright joined the Patriots for the 2014 season, and caught six touchdowns amid his 26 receptions. He came to the Patriots in a trade that included Logan Mankins. Chris O'Meara / AP Previous -- of -- Next Logan Mankins's nine-year tenure with the Patriots was sandwiched by Super Bowls, as he arrived in New England in 2005 and departed before the 2014 season. He played 146 games with the Patriots. Duane Burleson / AP Previous -- of -- Next Darius Butler spent two seasons with the Patriots after New England selected him in the second round of the 2009 NFL Draft. He played 29 games with the Patriots, recording 55 tackles, three interceptions, and 14 pass deflections. Matthew J. Lee / The Boston Globe Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Aqib Talib played 19 regular season games in the 2012 and 2013 seasons, recording 48 tackles, five interceptions, and 15 pass deflections. Chris Humphreys / USA Today Previous -- of -- Next Ryan Mallett was a three-year backup to Tom Brady, The Patriots drafted him in the third round of the 2011 NFL Draft. He played only four regular season games with four attempted passes. Derick E. Hingle / USA Today Previous -- of -- Next Brian Hoyer spent his first three years in the NFL with New England after going undrafted out of Michigan State. He played in 13 regular season games, and threw for 288 yards with one touchdown. Brynn Anderson / AP Previous -- of -- Next Adam Vinatieri played all 160 regular season games in his 10 seasons with New England. It was his postseason performances, however, that that has him securely placed in New England sporting lore. He kicked the game-winning field goal in Super Bowl XXXVIII. Sam Riche / AP Previous -- of -- Next Brandon Meriweather was the Patriots first-round selection in the 2007 NFL Draft. He played every regular season game with the Patriots during his four-year tenure, and recorded 181 tackles and 12 interceptions. Bill Kostroun / AP Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next The Patriots signed Danny Woodhead in 2010 after the running back was released by AFC rival Jets. In his three seasons with the Patriots, Woodhead rushed for 1,327 yards and 10 touchdowns. He also had 982 receiving yards and four receiving touchdowns. Rick Scuteri / AP Previous -- of -- Next Brandon Tate spent two seasons with the Patriots after New England selected the wide receiver in the third round of the 2009 NFL Draft. He caught 24 balls for 432 yards and three touchdowns. Phelan M. Ebenhack / AP Previous -- of -- Next A 2004 Patriots' first-round selection, Benjamin Watson played his first six NFL season with the Patriots. He had 167 receptions for 2,102 yards and 20 touchdowns during his time in New England. Andy Lyons / Getty Images
